definition: Han Xin (-196 BC), famous general of first Han emperor Liu Bang 劉邦|刘邦[Liu2 Bang1]
Han, one of the Seven Hero States of the Warring States 戰國七雄|战国七雄/Korea from the fall of the Joseon dynasty in 1897/Korea, esp. South Korea 大韓民國|大韩民国/surname Han
letter/mail/CL:封[feng1]/to trust/to believe/to profess faith in/truthful/confidence/trust/at will/at random

sentences.english: When Han arrived, there is no pot of rice.
sentences.chinese: 當韓信趕來，鍋裏已經沒有飯了。

sentences.english: Hong Hyun-ik is a North Korea researcher at the Sejong Institute in Seoul.
sentences.chinese: 韓信一是首爾世宗研究所的北韓問題研究員。

sentences.english: Thinking of his ambition, Han Xin swallowed the insult and crawled between the rascal's legs.
sentences.chinese: 向到自己的遠大志向，韓信忍辱爬了過去。

sentences.english: Han Xin made a kite with cowherd.
sentences.chinese: 當時是韓信用牛皮做一隻風箏。

sentences.english: Finally, we should also consider Han Kin's notion of fate in order to assess him comprehensively.
sentences.chinese: 最後，要全面看待韓信還要對他的天命觀有所認識。

sentences.english: Then the king called letter to him.
sentences.chinese: 於是漢王召見韓信拜他爲大將。

sentences.english: Han Xin made his living by fishing in his early days but he was very ambitious . He kept a sword with him everyday.
sentences.chinese: 韓信早年靠釣魚爲生，但他志向遠大，每天劍不離身。

sentences.english: The third message tells us that the Hanshin good with swords.
sentences.chinese: 第三個信息告訴我們，韓信好帶刀劍。

sentences.english: Conclusion The methods developed in this experiment can be used for the quality control of Herba Scutellaria indica.
sentences.chinese: 結論所用方法可用於韓信草的質量控制。

sentences.english: Later, Han Xin became a general of Han Dynasty and achieved fame.
sentences.chinese: 後來，韓信成爲漢朝大將，成就了一代英名。

sentences.english: Then added, Hanshin can not "rule of Health merchants."
sentences.chinese: 然後又說，韓信不能“治生商賈”。

definition: Liu Bei (161-223), warlord at the end of the Han dynasty and founder of the Han kingdom of Shu 蜀漢|蜀汉 (c. 200-263), later the Shu Han dynasty

Guan Yu (-219), general of Shu and blood-brother of Liu Bei in Romance of the Three Kingdoms, fearsome fighter famous for virtue and loyalty/posthumously worshipped and identified with the guardian Bodhisattva Sangharama
Zhao Yun (-229), general of Shu in Romance of the Three Kingdoms
Huang Zhong (-220), general of Shu in Romance of the Three Kingdoms, portrayed as an old fighter

Zhuge Liang (181-234), military leader and prime minister of Shu Han 蜀漢|蜀汉 during the Three Kingdoms period/the main hero of the fictional Romance of Three Kingdoms 三國演義|三国演义, where he is portrayed as a sage and military genius/mastermind
Liu Bang (256 or 247-195 BC), bandit leader who became first Han emperor Han Gaozu 漢高祖|汉高祖 (reigned 202-195 BC)
Jing Ke (-227 BC), celebrated in verse and fiction as would-be assassin of King Ying Zheng of Qin 秦嬴政 (later the First Emperor 秦始皇)

Di Renjie (607-700), Tang dynasty politician, prime minister under Wu Zetian, subsequently hero of legends/master sleuth Judge Dee, aka Chinese Sherlock Holmes, in novel Three murder cases solved by Judge Dee 狄公案[Di2 gong1 an4] translated by Dutch sinologist R.H. van Gulik 高羅珮|高罗佩[Gao1 Luo2 pei4]
Xiang Yu the Conqueror (232-202 BC), warlord defeated by first Han emperor
Sun Bin (-316 BC), political strategist of the School of Diplomacy 縱橫家|纵横家[Zong4 heng2 jia1] during the Warring States Period (425-221 BC)
Wei State (407-225 BC), one of the Seven Hero States of the Warring States 戰國七雄|战国七雄/Wei State or Cao Wei 曹魏 (220-265), the most powerful of the Three Kingdoms
the state of Chu, one of the most important of the small states contending for power in China between 770 and 223 BC, located around present-day Hubei
